results.title: Showbiz ballyhoo
results.creator_credit: Gail Gibson Sedawie, Norman Sedawie, Richard Gabourie Productions and T A D Productions
results.brief_description: This documentary examines the machinations and power of the Hollywood studio publicity departments of the 1930s and 40s, a time of the studios’ heyday, when the public had an unbridled fascination for the stars of the silver screen. On screen and off, fans were sold the notion of the dream, where glamour, money, fame and beauty were in endless supply. Movie newsreels, gossip columnists and press agents played a major role in presenting actors such as Errol Flynn, Clarke Gable and Vivien Leigh as eternally glamorous and gay, spending their lives at parties and opening night galas. Actors, celebrities and child stars were also used as a propaganda tool, sending messages that supported various causes, including war bonds, bills of government and political parties. Public appearances were as important as the films that the stars made, and actors were expected to tour on junkets around the country. Footage in the documentary includes clips from iconic Hollywood films, famous screen tests, bloopers and scenes from spectacular musical productions of the 1930s. Features footage of: Humphrey Bogart, Bette Davis, Joan Crawford, Bing Crosby, James Cagney, Shirley Temple, Mickey Rooney, Judy Garland, Ronald Reagan, Rita Hayworth, Tyrone Power and The Marx Brothers.

results.title: The Vision
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video concentrates on the alpine flora and fauna but also discusses Dietmar’s vision of the natural world. It focuses in the corroboree frog and again, the photography is excellent. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: The Survivor
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
At Dampier on the north west coast of Western Australia, a tidal creek has been dammed off from the sea to produce salt from seawater. Dietmar Fill puts the salt-ponds under the microscope in this study of how life responds to this increasingly stressful saline environment. Included is a general description of the Pilbara area and its former inhabitants, the salt lagoons and its mining.

results.title: Show me love = F*****g Amal
results.creator_credit: Lukas Moodysson, Lars Jonsson, Peter Aalbaek Jensen and Memphis Films
results.brief_description: This insightful and realistic film about teenage sexuality is set in a small Swedish town. Elin (Alexandra Dahlstrom) is beautiful and popular but the limitations of a small town lead her to increasing experimentation with alcohol, sex and drugs. Agnes (Reecca Liljeberg) is finding that after nearly two years in her new high school she is still largely friendless and alone. Elin and Agnes inhabit two very different social worlds but when they do finally meet they discover a disturbing and exciting sexual attraction for each other. Elin deals with this knowledge by throwing herself into a relationship with a shy diffident boy (Mathias Rust) while Agnes increasingly becomes to accept her lesbianism. “Show Me Love” is replete with incidents and moments that resonate with the confusions and tensions of adolescence. Refusing easy moralism or neat conclusions, Lukas Moodysson crafts an intelligent examination of contemporary youth culture. This is a gritty love story tenderly and convincingly performed by its young cast. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Estuary
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Features the plants (mangroves) and animals living in a tidal estuary at Port Stevens, Sydney. Discusses the habitat problems of tidal movement and salinity in fresh water. Narrated by Robin Williams.

results.title: Shore
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Where the sea meets the land we find a place of harsh extremes and constant change. Dietmar, Bibi and marine biologist Elizabeth Pope, explore the rich and varied life of the rocky seashore. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Lake
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ramsey, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
Dietmar focuses on a small freshwater lake near his home in the Blue Mountains west of Sydney. He explores the life of the lake and expresses his concern for the likely impact of pollution on its ecology. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Show business
results.creator_credit: Edwin Marin, Eddie Cantor and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Show business follows the fortunes of a small group of stage folk from 1914 to 1929 and is based on incidents from Eddie Cantor’s life. Features scenes from a variety of performers including minstrel shows, vaudeville, Grand Opera and Ziegfeld Follies. Songs include “You may not remenber me”, “It had to be you” and “Whoopee” Cast includes Eddie Cantor, Joan Davis, George Murphy and Constance Moore. Story by Bert Granet.

results.title: Coral reef
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video takes us to Herron Island, describes the wildlife and then concentrates on the smaller prcesses of reef builders. This program takes a while to get started. The coral photography is very good.

results.title: Short cuts. Magic movie screens: from vacuum cleaning to Plumper's dance party
results.creator_credit: Tina Douglas and Arts Project Australia
results.brief_description:
This is a compilation tape of animations produced by
disabled artists working with a mentor. “Short cuts”
features 30 seconds to 1 minute duration animation pieces and “Magic movie screens…” features slightly longer animated works of up to 5 minutes in length. The artists include Shirley Warke, Jimmy Fuller, Terry Williams,
Dorothy Berry, Cathy Staughton, Anne Lynch, John Northe, Fiona Longhurst, Alan Constable, Valerio Ciccone, Monica Burns, Tim Williams. Curated by Arts Project Australia with the support from Council of Adult, Community and Further Education, (Northern Metro Region).
